entry.title: Sydney Domville Rowland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pioneer radiologist Sydney Domville Rowland coined the term "skiagraphy" (example pictured)?

entry.title: Hickson Inc. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1920s, Hickson Inc. had the "most elegant and expensive specialty shop" on New York's Fifth Avenue?

entry.title: Konzerthalle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Konzerthalle in Bad Salzuflen, an example of spa architecture in the 1960s, is one of the regular venues of the Nordwestdeutsche Philharmonie?

entry.title: Eppa Hunton Jr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eppa Hunton Jr. and his son, Eppa Hunton IV, the namesakes of the Hunton Student Center at Virginia Commonwealth University, served a combined 50 years on the Medical College of Virginia's board of visitors?

entry.title: killed a Vietnamese woman after raping her (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a U.S. soldier who killed a Vietnamese woman after raping her was dubbed a "double veteran"?

entry.title: Karl R. Free (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that both of Karl R. Free's New Deal-era U.S. post office murals with Native American subjects have been challenged as offensive?

entry.title: district tartans for Australia as a whole, and also a state district tartan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Scottish Register of Tartans has registered district tartans for Australia as a whole, and also a state district tartan for each of Australia's six states?

entry.title: Bill Plante (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before bungee jumping with White House aides in New Zealand, senior White House correspondent Bill Plante said he was "proving that you're never too old to do something really stupid"?
